required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Subcutaneous Immunotherapy in Birch Pollen Allergic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Double-Blind Placebo-Controlled Study of Subcutaneous Immunotherapy in Birch Pollen Allergic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To compare versus placebo the efficacy and safety of recombinant Bet v1, natural purified Bet v1 and birch pollen licenced extract used for subcutaneous immunotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction of symptom and medication scores.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18-50 with seasonal rhinoconjunctivitis for at least 2 years, and/or mild asthma range 1 and 2 GINA.
- Positive history of birch pollen allergy (clinical history, positive skin prick test, birch specific IgE, presence of birch pollen)
- Compliant patients
- Written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Perennial rhinoconjunctivitis and/or asthma due to cosensitization with: animal danders, mites, alternaria cladosporium
- Uncontrolled seasonal asthma : severe asthma permanent or not range 3 and 4 of GINA.
- Patients treated with beta-blockers or under continuous oral corticosteroids.
- Pregnant women
